result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in custody.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Review hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 4/30/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Attorney Caitlin Firer for Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Michael R Zerzycki not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Ringersma for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a projected plea hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.

Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case was originally calendared for January 28, 2014. Courthouse complex was closed, case heard today.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Oral No Contact Order with DAVID K. OR 2907 S 44TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Michael R Zerzycki in custody.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
